sentences.en: " Friends, they are only gilded disks of lead! "
sentences.cn: " 朋友们, 这只不过是些镀金的铅饼!

sentences.en: A week later, the gilded age of Wall Street had faded away.
sentences.cn: 一周后, 华尔街黄金时代已逝去.

sentences.en: Along the walls flanking the gate the are ten gilded bronze vats.
sentences.cn: 沿着这个大门两侧有十个镀金的青铜大缸.

sentences.en: Children growing up in gilded cages can not bear hardships.
sentences.cn: 在蜜罐儿里长大的孩子,往往不能吃苦.

sentences.en: Gilt in the square: The foredge of a book gilded before rounding.
sentences.cn: 平切口刷金: 书本的切口刷上金箔然后圆脊.

sentences.en: I am bringing it from the frownery - the one over there with the gilded steeple.
sentences.cn: 我刚把它从烦恼工厂带过来，就是那边那个塔尖镀金的地方。

sentences.en: If not, maybe he a gilded future at the club.
sentences.cn: 反之, 他也许会在纽卡继续他的光明前途.

sentences.en: Some day I'm going to have a big gilded tooth outside my window for a sign.
sentences.cn: 总有一天我要在我窗子外面挂上一只镀金大牙作招牌.

sentences.en: Sunlight from the window gilded her shoulder - length blonde hair.
sentences.cn: 窗户透进的些许夕阳将她亚麻色的披肩长发染成了金色.

sentences.en: The dusk was gilded with fireflies.
sentences.cn: 薄暮被萤火虫点缀得金光闪闪.

sentences.en: The golden light gilded the sea.
sentences.cn: 金色的阳光使大海如金子般闪闪发光。

sentences.en: The holiest of their chapels are topped with gilded roofs.
sentences.cn: 他们最神圣的教堂屋顶镀了金。

sentences.en: The Lord Mayor follows at the rear in his gilded coach.
sentences.cn: 市长大人坐在他阔气的马车里在后面跟着。

sentences.en: The setting sun gilded the sky.
THERE was a man who had fine houses, both in town and country, a deal of silver and gold plate, embroidered furniture, and coaches gilded all over with gold.
sentences.cn: 从前有个男人，他在城里和乡间都有很精美的房子，有着大量金盘银盏，绣花罩着的家具，还有若干处处镀金的马车。

sentences.en: Who would not grieve upon a gilded chair?
sentences.cn: 谁不愿意坐在镀金的椅子上伤心 呢 ?

sentences.en: Winter a master miniaturist, making of our lives an intricate, would - in - a gilded - walnut - shell.
sentences.cn: 冬天是个技惊四座的微雕大师, 他把我们的世界雕进了一颗细美的 核桃壳 里.

words.tran_cn: 镀金；小母猪；眩目的外表
镀金（gild的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 镀金的，涂上金色的，装饰的，有钱的
把…镀金( gild的过去式和过去分词 )，给…上金色，作多余的修饰（反而破坏原已完美的东西），画蛇添足
